app.containers.AboutUs.aboutUs: We are a community of loyal fans of the legendary game Vietcong, mostly made up of former ESL league players who never gave up on this iconic shooter. After its removal from ESL, we kept the scene alive through occasional offline tournaments held once or twice a year. Today, as VietcongHub.eu, we are once again opening the space for competitive play — not only for seasoned veterans but also for newcomers who want to experience what Vietcong is all about. Our goal is to revive the community, promote fair play, and involve new players in tournaments within the framework of MČRVC – the Czech Championship in Vietcong.
app.containers.AboutUs.bambi: Eva is a charming blonde who effortlessly shatters every cliché about women of her hair color — with wit, intelligence, and an incredible feel for the game. Her strength lies in writing sharp, witty texts that entertain, hit just the right nerves, and still somehow manage not to offend. She has the rare talent of saying everything straight — in a way that makes you thank her for it. She’s from Brno, but unlike hhacker, she actually knows the local slang inside out. In Vietcong, she made a rocket-fast rise and started giving even the seasoned veterans a run for their money — so much so that a few years ago, the feared team iW!M recruited her into their lineup, where she shone at the last MČRVC. It’s no surprise her skills are in demand — her calendar is packed with more tournaments than beauty appointments, and she’s already booked for six upcoming events. In short: a gaming talent with a sharp tongue — and an even sharper aim.
app.containers.AboutUs.bascci: Martin is the one where it all began — the idea, the motivation, the drive to create and kickstart something that had been missing for a long time. As a developer, he started more as an eager explorer, but with every commit he’s growing, even he's learning with the intensity of someone constantly pushing uphill. At times he might feel like a pulled handbrake, but his teammates still appreciate him — because without him, this train probably wouldn't have left the station at all. He’s been playing Vietcong since 2007, but made his mark a few years later. His longest stays were with Free Secret and later with the legendary uNik0rn, with whom he won the last three MČRVC titles in a row. Away from the keyboard, you’ll most likely find him in the gym or in running shoes — as a fan of combat sports and an active lifestyle, he knows that being in top shape comes in handy not just at LAN parties.
app.containers.AboutUs.description: We know you'd like to know more about us, but we're currently working on higher priority content. Don't despair! Soon you will surely learn a lot of interesting things. In the meantime, you can visit <liga>league detail</liga> and see how your favorite team is doing. Or you can find out information about the upcoming <mcrvc>Czech Championship</mcrvc>.
app.containers.AboutUs.hhacker: Viktor is a backend genius from Brno who joined the development team a bit later — but when he did, he hit the ground running so hard that the rest of the team could only stare in disbelief at the commit history. His code is clean, thoughtful, and powerful — unlike his Brno slang, which sometimes even he doesn’t fully understand. He’s been playing Vietcong since the dawn of time — specifically since 2004. Since then, he’s found success in online gaming and has also taken part in several offline tournaments, earning a spot among the original legends. After a long break, he returned to this classic as if no time had passed — and immediately reminded everyone that old-school skill never fades. His greatest success came with the team LvS, which commanded respect (and occasionally mild panic) from opponents even before the match had started.
app.containers.AboutUs.title: About Us
app.containers.AboutUs.trapper: Vojta is a frontend wizard and one of the main driving forces behind VietcongHub. When he’s not coding the website that connects the community, you’ll find him with a mouse in hand and Vietcong on the screen — where he ranks among the sharpest shooters, as proven by his collection of trophies from offline tournaments. As the captain of the legendary team RotS (Riders on the Storm), he was a nightmare for opponents for years and a symbol of tournament dominance. He loves this game and lives for it — and thanks to him, the website looks and works exactly as it should. And when he’s not hunting frags or writing code, he shines in ping pong and fast cycling, where his style remains the same: fast, precise, and ruthless.
app.containers.AboutUs.whoIsHiding: Our team consists of three developers and one editor, but the project is also supported by dozens of community members who contribute in various ways – from testing and administration to promotion. We are united by a common goal: to show that Vietcong is still alive – and that it still has something to offer both long-time fans and a new generation of players.
app.containers.AboutUs.whoIsHidingTitle: And who is behind all of this?!

app.containers.Championship.description: The Czech Championship in Vietcong, also known as MČRVC, has been held since 2010. Except for a few breaks, it has been regularly organized on the last weekend of September. Over the years, a spring edition was also introduced, taking place at the end of March/April. This year is no exception, and upcoming events are already scheduled for both terms. Mark the following dates in your calendar!
app.containers.Championship.moreInfo: For more information check facebook page
app.containers.Donate.acknowledgment: WE WILL BE GRATEFUL FOR ANY CONTRIBUTION!
app.containers.Donate.anonymousDonation: Want to stay incognito? Message hhacker on Discord.{br}Discretion guaranteed – even without an ombudsman or GDPR training.
app.containers.Donate.description: VietcongHUB is not a company. Not even a startup. And it’s definitely not a project meant to make money. It’s a community passion project. A place created by the players themselves, which lives and dies with them. Everything you see on VietcongHUB – from the league, to the website and servers, to offline events – is built on volunteering. Not because someone has to, but because there’s always someone who wants to. {br}And if it makes sense to you too, you can lend a helping hand.
app.containers.Donate.donationAcknowledg: By making a voluntary contribution to our transparent account, you help further develop something we create together.
app.containers.Donate.firstReason: servers will keep running (thanks Crypťo for keeping them alive!),
app.containers.Donate.fourthReason: prize money to add a bit of spice to competitive play.
app.containers.Donate.reasonsDescription: How about two beers a month? One will spill anyway, the other will go warm.{br}Here, though, they will make someone happy. We won’t use it for a Caribbean vacation, but:
app.containers.Donate.secondReason: promotion via PPC, Facebook, YouTube to keep the community active and attract new players,
app.containers.Donate.subtitle: You can send a one-time payment. Or set up a recurring one.
app.containers.Donate.thirdReason: allow us to produce awesome merch you can either order or win directly in the league,
app.containers.Donate.title: I Want to Support VietcongHUB
app.containers.ErrorBoundary.description: Something just went wrong and it's definitely not your fault. Lags, losses, the opponent is bugging and you have 30 to resp.
app.containers.ErrorBoundary.title: Even Trapper makes mistakes sometimes
app.containers.Home.components.Banners.d: Join us on Discord and don't miss a thing!

Whether you've just heard of Vietcong for the first time or are returning after years, on our Discord you'll find everything you need. We offer an active community, regular league matches, and members who are happy to guide you, advise you, and bring you into the game. Here it's not just about frags, but about fun and a community that sticks together. We’ll be glad to see you at one of our offline events too.
app.containers.Home.components.Banners.h: If you need help getting the game running, you can find the guide here.
app.containers.Home.components.Banners.l: The CTF mode is a staple in Vietcong. But the days when untouchable teams ruled the scene and newcomers just scraped by are over. On VietcongHUB, we play it differently. We place players into performance brackets and create balanced teams that face off fairly.
A strong community that will welcome you in
app.containers.Home.components.Banners.r: Compete with players from the Czech Republic and Slovakia. Every match, kill, and flag counts.
Play with a new team every match
Teams and opponents are matched based on performance
Place yourself in the national ranking
Match times are arranged by the players
app.containers.Home.title: Home Page
app.containers.HowToPlay.description: If you want to play Vietcong with fully functional multiplayer, including the ability to see servers, we recommend downloading the pre-prepared Vietcong – Gold Edition package with the VC Starter 1.7 beta tool, which greatly simplifies everything. The full guide is covered in 5 steps. If anything in the guide is unclear, we recommend following the video tutorial by player Peldovitch.
app.containers.HowToPlay.fifthStep: If you still need help, join the Discord, where the community will help you with any problem so you can play with us.
app.containers.HowToPlay.firstStep: Download the complete game folder (already prepared, no installation needed): <link>HERE</link>
app.containers.HowToPlay.forthStep: In the game’s main menu, select “Multiplayer” → “Internet”. The servers should display without problems. The master server fix should be correctly installed (it’s already part of the folder).
app.containers.HowToPlay.hostsFile: If you still don’t see the servers, go to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts -> open 'hosts' as administrator and add 46.28.109.117 master.gamespy.com to the last line -> save the notepad and run the game. The servers should now appear.
app.containers.HowToPlay.listItem3: VCStarter 1.7 beta (windowed mode, resolution, alt+tab, widescreen, FPS unlock, etc.)
app.containers.HowToPlay.secondStepTitle: 2. What’s Included in the Gold Edition?
app.containers.HowToPlay.subtitle: Complete Guide: Vietcong Gold Edition (VC Starter 1.7 beta) + functional multiplayer
app.containers.HowToPlay.thirdStep: Start the game via the VCStarter.exe file. This will activate the modern launcher, where you can:
app.containers.HowToPlay.thirdStepItem2: Launch the game in windowed / fullscreen mode
app.containers.HowToPlay.title: How to Run Vietcong
app.containers.HowToPlay.unzip: After downloading, extract the file, for example into C:\Games\Vietcong.
